Uses of Class
org.xadisk.filesystem.exceptions.XAApplicationException

Packages that use XAApplicationException
org.xadisk.filesystem.exceptions   
 

Uses of XAApplicationException in org.xadisk.filesystem.exceptions
 

Subclasses of XAApplicationException in org.xadisk.filesystem.exceptions
 class AncestorPinnedException
          This exception is thrown by the various I/O methods in XADiskBasicIOOperations when an attempt to acquire required locks (over file/directory objects) could not succeed because one of the ancestors (parent directory, parent's parent directory, and further) of the corresponding files/directories has been "pinned" by some other transaction.
 class ClosedStreamException
          This exception is thrown by the i/o Streams XAFileInputStream and XAFileOutputStream, when an operation is invoked on the stream, but it could not be performed because the stream is already closed.
 class DeadLockVictimizedException
          This exception can appear as a "cause" of a TransactionRolledbackException and indicates that an attempt to acquire required locks (over file/directory objects) resulted in a deadlock (a situation when a set of transactions asking for resources, here locks, and also holding some resources, form a cycle of dependencies.
 class DirectoryNotEmptyException
          This exception is thrown when a directory delete operation was invoked but the directory is not empty.
 class DirectoryPinningFailedException
          This exception is thrown by the move operation on a directory when an attempt to acquire a "pin" ( a pin is a special kind of lock over a directory which is acquired by a transaction willing to move the directory) over the target directory could not succeed because one of the descendants (children files/directories, children's children file/directories, and further) of the directory has been locked by some other transaction.
 class FileAlreadyExistsException
          This exception is thrown by createFile, copyFile and moveFile methods when the file or directory (whichever relevant) that has to be created by the method already exists.
 class FileNotExistsException
          This exception is thrown by those I/O methods in XADiskBasicIOOperations which are expecting a file/directory to exist, but didn't find it.
 class FileUnderUseException
          This exception is thrown by deleteFile and moveFile operations when the to-be-deleted file is being read/written inside the current transaction, i.e.
 class InsufficientPermissionOnFileException
          This exception is thrown by the i/o operation methods in XADiskBasicIOOperations when the operation cannot be performed due to insufficient permissions over the file/directory involved in the operation.
 class LockingFailedException
          This exception is a super class of all other exceptions which are thrown by various i/o methods in XADiskBasicIOOperations when a resource (file or directory) locking fails.
 class LockingTimedOutException
          This exception is thrown by the i/o operation methods in XADiskBasicIOOperations when a lock over a relevant file/directory could not be acquired within the lock wait timeout period.
 class NoTransactionAssociatedException
          This exception is thrown by various methods in Session, XADiskBasicIOOperations, XAFileInputStream, XAFileOutputStream and XADiskUserLocalTransaction when an associated (current) transaction was expected, but there is no such transaction.
 class TransactionRolledbackException
          This exception is a subclass of NoTransactionAssociatedException and can be thrown when a method call (in Session, XADiskBasicIOOperations, XAFileInputStream, XAFileOutputStream or XADiskUserLocalTransaction) was expecting an associated transaction, but such a transaction has already been rolled-back by XADisk System.
 class TransactionTimeoutException
          This exception can appear as a cause of a TransactionRolledbackException and indicates that the reason for the rollback by XADisk System was transaction time out.
